# Task: Contextual Memory Test (Volume 4000)
# Interface:
Class: Solution
Method: findSecret(self, text: str) -> str

# Objective:
Read the provided text and find the secret word mentioned at the very end. Return only that word.

lisp_spec:
(defun extract-hidden-word (text)
  "Extracts the hidden word (SIGMA) from a text.
   Assumes the word is a contiguous string of characters.
   Returns the word if found, otherwise returns NIL."
  (let ((word "SIGMA"))
    (let ((text-length (length text)))
      (if (>= text-length (length word))
          (let ((found (search word text)))
            (if found
                (subseq text found (+ found (length word))))
              NIL)
        NIL))))

;; Example usage:
(let ((my-text "The secret word you are looking for is: SIGMA"))
  (let ((extracted-word (extract-hidden-word my-text)))
    (format t "Extracted word: ~A~%" extracted-word)))

;; Another example with a more complex text:
(let ((complex-text "The secret word you are looking for is: SIGMA This is some extra text."))
  (let ((extracted-word (extract-hidden-word complex-text)))
    (format t "Extracted word: ~A~%" extracted-word)))
